{"id":922764941,"question_id":4,"lang":"java","lang_name":"Java","time":"1 year, 2 months","timestamp":1679887175,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/922764941/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Median of Two Sorted Arrays","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\n    public double findMedianSortedArrays(int[] nums1, int[] nums2) {\n        double res = 0d;\n        \n        int len1 = nums1.length;\n        int len2 = nums2.length;\n        int i=0, j=0;\n        \n        if(len1+len2==0)\n            return 0;\n        \n        Integer prev = null, curr=null;\n        \n        while(i+j<=(len1+len2)/2){\n            \n            \n            if(i<len1 && j<len2){\n                if(nums1[i]<=nums2[j]){\n                    curr = nums1[i];\n                    i++;\n                }else{\n                    curr = nums2[j];\n                    j++;\n                }    \n            }else if(i<len1){\n                curr = nums1[i];\n                i++;\n                \n            }else{\n                curr = nums2[j];\n                j++;\n            }\n            prev=curr;\n        }\n        if((len1+len2)%2==0){\n            return (Double.valueOf(prev)+Double.valueOf(curr))/2;\n        }\n        \n        return Double.valueOf(curr);\n        \n    }\n}\n\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"median-of-two-sorted-arrays","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
